instructions: Place ribs in a large stock pot, and cover with water. Bring to a boil, and cook for 15 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, mix together soup, onion, garlic, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce. Remove ribs from water, and transfer to a slow cooker. Pour sauce over ribs.
Cover, and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours, or until ribs are tender.

If sauce is too thin when cooking time is done, drain sauce from ribs, and pour into a sauce pan. Combine 1 teaspoon cornstarch with a small amount of cold water, stir into sauce, and bring sauce to boil. Cook until sauce has reached desired thickness.
title: Slow Cooker Spare Ribs
sentences: Place ribs in a large stock pot, and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, and cook for 15 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, mix together soup, onion, garlic, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce.
Remove ribs from water, and transfer to a slow cooker.
Cover, and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours, or until ribs are tender.
If sauce is too thin when cooking time is done, drain sauce from ribs, and pour into a sauce pan.
Combine 1 teaspoon cornstarch with a small amount of cold water, stir into sauce, and bring sauce to boil.
Cook until sauce has reached desired thickness.
